tr.td: Vincent Massol and Ted Husted are writing "JUnit In Action", a book on unit testing java applications. Amongst other things, it covers extensively Cactus 1.5 (about 7 chapters covering Cactus). The book will soon be available in bookstores.
Release 2.0 of the Cactus plugin for Maven is out. It is now a pure wrapper around the new Cactus/Ant Integration.
Vincent Massol will be a speaker at the TheServerSide Symposium where he will present Unit Testing J2EE Applications, which talks about Cactus, Mock Objects and AspectJ (AOP).

StrutsTestCase v1.9.5 has been released. It improves support for Struts 1.1b3 (including support for testing Tiles and sub-applications), provides several requested enhancements, and fixes many reported defects.
JavaDevWithAnt. Project demonstrating Ant, XDoclet, Struts, JUnit, Cactus, and Lucene.
Release 1.0 of the Cactus plugin for Maven is out. This is certainly the easiest way to run Cactus tests so far. This plugin is part of the core Maven plugins and is thus delivered with Maven.
Article from Sheldon Wosnick explaining how to use Cactus inside WebSphere Studio Application Developer (WSAD).

New Test flexibly with AspectJ and mock objects article by Nick Lesiecki: It demonstrates how to use AspectJ in association with Mock Objects to provide greater test flexibility. It also shows how AspectJ can complement Cactus tests.

Kaarle Kaila has started KaCoMa: KaCoMa (abbreviation for Kaarle's ContentManagement until further notice) is a ContentManagement system for web-sites that serves as a tutorial for beginners of custom taglibraries and/or Unit testing of corresponding software.
Cactus BOF at OT2002 led by Vincent Massol from OCTO Technology.

Speech on Cactus and the Jakarta Community entitled "Itineraire d'un logiciel libre: Jakarta Cactus" at the Luxembourg Free Open Source days ("Journees du Libre"). Led by Vincent Massol from OCTO Technology.
Cactus is now integrated in Objecteering. Read here for details about this integration.
Together Control Center 6.0 now incorporates the concept of Test Plan and has tight integration with JUnit, HttpUnit and Cactus.
StrutsTestCase for JUnit is a framework for un it testing Struts code. It provides both mock objects and a Cactus integration for testing inside and outside of the container.

New book on open source tools for XP, including a big chapter on Cactus:
Java Tools for Extreme Programming: Mastering Open Source Tools, including Ant, JUnit, and Cactus. By Rick Hightower and Nicholas Lesiecki from eBlox.
Presentation of Cactus at London JSIG. Led by Vincent Massol from OCTO Technology.
Article on Cactus from Earthweb: Cactus: no pity for bugs.

Transition to a new web site stylesheet that more heavily relies on CSS. Apart from easier maintenance, it should provide a more consistent look as well as far superior printability. Naturally, the new site will look a bit odd on old browsers like Netscape 4.x, but still should be quite usable.
Added automatic script support for JBoss 3.x. They are delivered as part of the Cactus distribution.
New tutorial that explains how to build Cactus from the sources. Check the Build Howto now !
Cactus 1.4.1 has been released ! It is purely a bug fix release. Get it from the Download area. Complete change log is available here.
Cactus 1.4 final is released ! Get it from the Download area. Complete change log is available here.
Cactus 1.4 beta 1 is released ! Get it from the Download area. Complete change log is available here.
Added automatic script support for Orion 1.6. They are delivered as part of the Cactus distribution.
Added automatic script support for WebLogic 7.0. They are delivered as part of the Cactus distribution.
Added Test Coverage Reports that shows how good (or how bad !) Cactus self tests are. We have used Clover to generate these reports.
New Quick start tutorial that explains how to run Cactus tests quickly in Tomcat.
New tutorial that explains a new of running Cactus tests: through a browser. Check the TestRunner Howto now !
Cactus 1.3 is released ! Get it from the Download area. Complete change log is available here.
New Tested On ... page which lists what containers have been tested with Cactus.
New Cactus users page.
New Security tutorial.
New logo proposals by Alessandro Ceglia, Dimenzio Design Works and Arthur Jasso.
New logo proposals by Alessandro Ceglia !
New JBuilder 5 tutorial for Cactus integration. Thanks Sean !
New Web site Statistics page.
Link to Cactus nightly build result added to the left menu in the developer section.
